dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.intent_recognition module

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.intent_recognition.get_intent_name(intent, threshold=0.5)[source]

Retrieves the name of the recognized intent based on the provided intent object.

Parameters:

  • intent (dict) – The intent object containing information about the recognized intent.

  • threshold (float) – The probability threshold for considering the intent as valid.

Returns:

The name of the recognized intent if its probability is above the threshold, otherwise None.

Return type:

str or None

Example

intent_name = get_intent_name(intent_obj, threshold=0.6)

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.intent_recognition.get_mentioned_entities(intent)[source]

Retrieves the key-value pairs from the slots of an intent.

Parameters:

intent (dict) – The intent object containing slots.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the key-value pairs extracted from the slots.

Returns None if the intent is None, slots are None, or if there are no slots.

Return type:

dict

'probabilistic_intent_parser'}], 'unit_name': 'nlu_engine'})[source]

Initialize the intent recognition engine using the provided dataset file.

Parameters:

  • dataset_path (str) – Path to the JSON dataset file containing the intents and their corresponding utterances.

  • config (str) – The configuration to use for the SnipsNLUEngine.default is english

Returns:

A trained instance of the SnipsNLUEngine used for intent recognition.

Return type:

SnipsNLUEngine

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.intent_recognition.is_addressed_to_drone(intent, name='sammy', similar_pronunciation=None)[source]

Checks if the intent is addressed to the drone

Parameters:

  • intent (dict) – The intent object containing slots.

  • name (str) – The name in which the drone is to be addressed, this should be the same name that the intent classifier ia trained with.

  • similar_pronunciation (list) – A list of names that sound similar to the name of the drone

Returns:

True if the intent is addressed to the drone, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

//snips-nlu.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial.html

Type:

in order to get the trained json file follow the https

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.intent_recognition.recognize_intent(engine, text)[source]

Given a trained SnipsNLUEngine and a string of text, this function parses the text and returns a dictionary representing the detected intent and associated slots.

Parameters:

  • engine (SnipsNLUEngine) – An instance of SnipsNLUEngine, which has been trained on a dataset of intents

  • text (str) – A string of text to be parsed by the NLU engine

Returns:

  • input: the given input text

  • intent: An object containing intentName, probability.

  • slots: A dictionary containing key-value pairs of detected slots

Return type:

A dictionary representing the detected intent and associated slots, with the following keys

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.object_detection_yolo.get_boxes_yolo(yolo_engine, image)[source]

Get the bounding boxes of objects detected in an image using a YOLO (You Only Look Once) object detection engine.

Parameters:

  • yolo_engine (YoloEngine) – The YoloEngine object used for object detection.

  • image – The image to detect objects in.

Returns:

A list of bounding boxes corresponding to the objects detected in the image.

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.object_detection_yolo.get_label_yolo(yolo_engine, image)[source]

Get the labels of objects detected in an image using a YOLO (You Only Look Once) object detection engine.

Parameters:

  • yolo_engine (YoloEngine) – The YoloEngine object used for object detection.

  • image – The image to detect objects in.

Returns:

A list of labels corresponding to the objects detected in the image.

Initialize a YOLO (You Only Look Once) object detection engine.

Parameters:

weights_path (str) – The file path to the pre-trained weights file.

Returns:

None.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the specified configuration or labels file is not found.

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.speech_2_text_conversion.classify(raw_text)[source]
dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.speech_2_text_conversion.init_speech_to_text_engine(language)[source]

Initializes a speech-to-text engine using the Vosk model for a given language. (currently only supports ‘en-US’ language)

Args: - language: a string representing the language code to use (e.g. ‘en-us’, ‘fr-fr’)

Returns: - a Vosk KaldiRecognizer object that can be used for speech recognition

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.speech_2_text_conversion.queue = []

The language of the model. The default is ‘en-US’. (currently only supports this language) :return: The vosk model.

need to initialize the model before using the speech to text engine.

Type:

param language

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.speech_2_text_conversion.recognize_command(model, audio_feed)[source]

Recognizes a command from an audio feed using a given model.

Args: - model: The vosk model that is returned by the init_speech_to_text_engine(). - audio_feed: a byte string representing the audio feed to recognize, taken by audio_feed.read(num_frames)

Returns: - a label indicating the recognized command, or None if no command was recognized

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.speech_2_text_conversion.recognize_speech(model, audio_feed)[source]

Recognizes a text from an audio feed using a given model.

Args: - model: The vosk model that is returned by the init_speech_to_text_engine(). - audio_feed: a byte string representing the audio feed to recognize, taken by audio_feed.read(num_frames)

Returns: - the text that was recognized, or None if no text was recognized

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.text_2_speech_conversion module

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.text_2_speech_conversion.generate_speech_and_play(engine, text)[source]

Generates speech from the provided text using a text-to-speech engine and plays it.

Parameters:

  • engine (TTS Engine) – The text-to-speech engine instance capable of generating speech.

  • text (str) – The text to be converted into speech and played.

Returns:

None

Example

engine = TextToSpeechEngine() generate_speech_and_play(engine, “Hello, how can I assist you?”)

dronebuddylib.offline.atoms.text_2_speech_conversion.init_text_to_speech_engine(rate=150, volume=1, voice_id='TTS_MS_EN-US_ZIRA_11.0')[source]

Initializes and configures a text-to-speech engine for generating speech.

Args:

rate (int): The speech rate in words per minute (default is 150). volume (float): The speech volume level (default is 1.0). voice_id (str): The identifier of the desired voice (default is ‘TTS_MS_EN-US_ZIRA_11.0’).

Returns:

pyttsx3.Engine: The initialized text-to-speech engine instance.

Example:

engine = init_text_to_speech_engine(rate=200, volume=0.8, voice_id=’TTS_MS_EN-US_DAVID_11.0’) generate_speech_and_play(engine, “Hello, how can I assist you?”)

Notes

since this is the offline model, can only support this voice for the moment

‘This is a wrapper for ttx.
